system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice subject/ object by Describing seasons with 'it'. I want to ensure that I can use 'it' as an empty subject when there is nothing else to put in subject position, particularly with weather or time. For example, 'it is sunny, it is 7 AM, it is close to lunch time, it was rainy'. Let's do a Q&A exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. Start by describing the current season where you live using ‘it is’, then ask me questions about the season here. (e.g. 'It is spring here. What season is it there?', 'It is warm in spring here. How is it there?') Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

system_rephrase_prompt.content: ; System manager: This message contains advanced grammar. Please rephrase it without using

system_wrap_up_prompt.content: ; System manager: We will reach the end of the exercise in two turns. Begin wrapping up the chat coherently.

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a Q&A exercise, by Describing seasons with 'it', using, for example, 'it is sunny, it is 7 AM, it is close to lunch time, it was rainy'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! It is autumn here. The leaves are falling. What season is it there?
Hello! It is spring here. It is sunny. The flowers are blooming.
Hello! It is autumn here. It is cool and windy. How is the weather in spring there? Is it warm or cold?
It is okay! Let’s try again. It is autumn here. It is cloudy today. Is it sunny or rainy in spring there?
It is sunny. It is warm in spring.
That sounds nice! It is autumn here. It is getting colder every day. Do you like spring? What do you like to do when it is warm and sunny?
Yes, I like spring! It is nice to go for walks when it is warm and sunny. I like to see the flowers.
Good job! You did very well describing the season and using 'it' correctly. I’m glad you like spring and enjoy the flowers. I enjoyed talking to you about the seasons. Talk to you later!
conversation.advanced_content: Good job! You did very well describing the season and using 'it' correctly. I’m glad you like spring and enjoy the flowers. It was nice talking to you about the seasons. Talk to you later!
